content.rendered:
What are Logisticians?

Logisticians analyze the supply, demand, and distribution of a given company’s product or service. They are also in charge of streamlining the delivery process.

Where do Logisticians work?

  • Manufacturing companies
  • Government
  • Technical service companies

How much do Logisticians make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Logistician is $46,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Logisticians?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Business majors
  • Supply chain management majors
  • Engineering majors
Search Logistician jobs on Handshake

Logistician skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Logisticians succeed in their work:

  • Strong analytical skills
  • Ability to multitask
  • Great organization

What are some common questions about Logisticians?

Q: What degree do I need to become a Logistician?

A: Either an associate’s degree or a bachelor’s degree in a related field! The requirements really depend on the employer.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming a Logistician.
